page.title: 16Housing in Calbourne.
page.content: As Calbourne is an old fashioned rural village most of the houses are pretty {cottage-type}constructions, many retaining their thatched roofs. The farm houses and workers cottages outside the village are generally detached. However in the village about a third are detached, a third semi- detached and the remainder terraced. Generally they are constructed either of{brick}or{stone}with{tiled}or{slate} roofs. Houses date from 400 years old to the most recent building which was constructed about five years ago. Many homes have central heating but most still make use of an open fire.
